desc: <span class='help-method'>C-Support Vector Classification. The implementation is based on libsvm. The fit time complexity is more than quadratic with the number of samples which makes it hard to scale to dataset with more than a couple of 10000 samples. The multiclass support is handled according to a one-vs-one scheme. For details on the precise mathematical formulation of the provided kernel functions and how gamma, coef0 and degree affect each other, see the corresponding section in the narrative documentation: Kernel functions.
urlparagraph: Read more in the User Guide.

tutorial.desc: Learn more on Oncoscape + Sci-Kit clustering methods

params.name: C
params.desc: Penalty parameter C of the error term.

params.name: kernel
params.desc: Specifies the kernel type to be used in the algorithm.

params.name: degree
params.desc: Degree of the polynomial kernel function (‘poly’).

params.name: shrinking
params.desc: Whether to use the shrinking heuristic.

params.name: probability
params.desc: Whether to enable probability estimates. This must be enabled prior

params.name: cache_size
params.desc: Specify the size of the kernel cache (in MB).

params.name: class_weight
params.desc: Set the parameter C of class i to class_weight[i]*C for

params.name: max_iter
params.desc: Hard limit on iterations within solver, or -1 for no limit.

params.name: decision_function_shape
params.desc: Whether to return a one-vs-rest (‘ovr’) decision function of shape

params.name: random_state
params.type: int, RandomState instance or None, optional (default=None)
params.desc: The seed of the pseudo random number generator used when shuffling

attrs.name: n_support_
attrs.desc: Number of support vectors for each class.

attrs.name: dual_coef_
attrs.desc: Coefficients of the support vector in the decision function.

attrs.name: coef_
attrs.desc: Weights assigned to the features (coefficients in the primal
